page.title: 12RINGLEY COOLING TOWERS
page.content: THE MASSIVE{COOLING TOWERS}OF{KEARSLEY {POWER STATION}WERE SUCCESSFULLY DEMOLISHED ON{SUNDAY,MAY 12TH 1985.} THOUSANDS OF PEOPLE CAME TO WATCH THE BLAST AND STOOD AT A SAFE DISTANCE SO THEY COULD WITNESS THE 5 TREMENDOUS GIANTS FALL.{JOHN TURNER}OF{NORTHERN {EXPLOSIVES LTD.}PRESSED THE RED BUTTON WHICH TRIGGERED THE EXPLOSIVES PLACED IN THE LEGS OF EACH TOWER. THE BLAST WAS HEARD IN{BOLTON}SEVERAL MILES AWAY. THE ONLY DAMAGE WAS TWO BROKEN WINDOWS WHICH WERE IMMEDIATELY REPLACED. POLICEMEN COVERED THE AREA AND AMBULANCES WERE ON STANDBY AS THE BLASTS WERE HEARD. AFTER THE EXCITEMENT FADED{RINGLEY}RETURNED ONCE MORE TO A PEACEFUL SCENE. THE{COOLING TOWERS}WERE DOWN, MUCH TO THE DELIGHT OF CAMPAIGNERS WHO HAD BEEN PROTESTING FOR YEARS ABOUT THE SITE.
